ileri.lawal: I was one of the first five attendees to arrive and I sat in till the very end. I was glad that she not only spoke but also took all the questions asked. I was glad that my "fantasy" did come true and I was there to witness every second of it.

iam_michaeledison: SCARS OF A WOMAN From birth she was received as inferior, She grew to become a work horse. Her ego began to deflate, Her role became grievous, She began to query her identity, Her identity became apologetic, She sought for freedom but found scars. From then she grew with ashes, Her smiles tastes bitter inward. She desire to be treated like him, She yen for her voice to be heard, Yet love still paint her heart. She is emotional and strong, Strong to withstand cultural cage. She was made of gold, But her body is full of scars. She is perceived as a weaker vessel, So she kneels to the other with muscle. She carries his seed in her with care, She is bound to serve the other kind, She served in kind, spirit and soul, But behold her pay cheque is wound and scars. © MICHAEL EDISON
